Forgive me if this is a FAQ, but I have tried digging through the documenta=
tion and the answer was not apparent.

I am writing some test cases.  As pa=
rt of the testing, I want to keep a log of the responses from the code for =
debugging purposes.  It would be really helpful to have some simple process=
 to print out the tests name and other properties into the log.  Since ther=
e are hundreds of tests, I would like to make this a common step (ie call a=
 method) to do this.  Problem is finding the name of the test itself (witho=
ut having to pass it into the logging method or hacking the stack).

I see =
there is a Description class in the runner.  Is there any way to access the=
 runner (i.e. a singleton or static getter) from the test case?
